doc.field: This series includes primarily items related to 7th Regiment events, World War I, the 7th's Mexican border service, companies, and veterans. Material related to 7th Regiment events includes programs, tickets, announcements, and menus for various dinners, balls, excursions, celebrations, and concerts (1820-1964). World War I material contains instructional, promotional, and recruitment items from the Red Cross and other relief organizations, the armed services, the U.S. Food Administration, and various other sources. Ephemera related to the 7th's Mexican border service in 1916 is primarily newspaper clippings, also some New York State election material. Company ephemera mostly documents company events, such as dinners, parties, and entertainment. Veteran material is also mainly events related, especially annual dinners and reunions.

Other material in this series includes 7th Regiment and National Guard recruitment items; pamphlets, brochures, flyers, posters, and circulars from various sources; Civil War broadsides that advertise amusements; training material; divine service and memorial programs; various ads and catalogs; election nominee slips and calling cards; postcards; non-military or 7th Regiment certificates; and newspaper clippings.
